item.title:
RT by @RaviSubbie: Dominic Raab won‚Äôt approve but I did indeed go the opera last week (it cost me ¬£62).
Tom Eisner, a working-class lad from Buxton near where I grew up kindly invited me. He‚Äôs been playing violin at Glyndebourne for 36 years.
Never let anyone tell you you‚Äôre not good enough. üéª

item.title: RT by @RaviSubbie: Angela Rayner best put down since Julia Gillard demolished Tony Abbott sexism ‚ÄúMy advice to the Deputy PM is to cut out the snobbery and brush up on his opera. The Marriage of Figaro is the story of a working-class woman who gets the better of a privileged but dim-witted villain‚Äù

item.title:
RT by @RaviSubbie: NEW: Rayner responds to Raab's jibe at her for going to the opera
"My advice to the deputy prime minister is to cut out the snobbery & brush up on his opera. The Marriage of Figaro is the story of a working-class woman who gets the better of a privileged but dim-witted villain."
item.dc:creator: @nadinebh_
item.description:
NEW: Rayner responds to Raab's jibe at her for going to the opera

"My advice to the deputy prime minister is to cut out the snobbery & brush up on his opera. The Marriage of Figaro is the story of a working-class woman who gets the better of a privileged but dim-witted villain."

item.title: R to @RaviSubbie: And a trade union official you'd not be surprised to hear that I take class discrimination and diversity very seriously.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: And a trade union official you'd not be surprised to hear that I take class discrimination and diversity very seriously.

item.title: R to @MattSingh_: I'm from a very average town on the North East Lincs coast (grew up there in the 70s/80s). Both parents migrants (tho from v different countries). I'm a trade union official and I still occasionally get white people in the wider labour movement who lecture me on racism.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: I'm from a very average town on the North East Lincs coast (grew up there in the 70s/80s). Both parents migrants (tho from v different countries). I'm a trade union official and I still occasionally get white people in the wider labour movement who lecture me on racism.

item.title: I know why they do it, but people who use examples of rape or health dangers to women to make the pro choice argument miss the wider point. A woman's right to choose is not contingent upon how conception happened or health issues.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: I know why they do it, but people who use examples of rape or health dangers to women to make the pro choice argument miss the wider point. A woman's right to choose is not contingent upon how conception happened or health issues.

item.title: I predict the 1922 committee will be meeting soon and changing the rules for a vote of no confidence in the leader.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: I predict the 1922 committee will be meeting soon and changing the rules for a vote of no confidence in the leader.

item.title: RT by @RaviSubbie: Earlier today, @grantshapps bragged about introducing new legislation to bring in agency workers to break strikes. It seems pertinent, therefore, to share his words about our members during COVID when, far from being militant trade unionists, he described them as "true heroes".
item.dc:creator: @RMTunion
item.description:
Earlier today, @grantshapps bragged about introducing new legislation to bring in agency workers to break strikes.
It seems pertinent, therefore, to share his words about our members during COVID when, far from being militant trade unionists, he described them as "true heroes".

item.title: R to @PranMan: As you will discern from my name I'm of Indian origin. I understand the culture. One of the primary drivers of this is class. There are plenty of Indian origin people who aren't like Patel et al - there's quite a few Indian Workers Associations in the UK.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: As you will discern from my name I'm of Indian origin. I understand the culture. One of the primary drivers of this is class. There are plenty of Indian origin people who aren't like Patel et al - there's quite a few Indian Workers Associations in the UK.

item.title: I hope the government put Nadine Dorries up against Mick Lynch for tomorrow's media rounds. That would be an absolute belter to watch.
item.dc:creator: @RaviSubbie
item.description: I hope the government put Nadine Dorries up against Mick Lynch for tomorrow's media rounds. That would be an absolute belter to watch.

item.title: RT by @RaviSubbie: ‚ÄòOpposing modernisation..‚Äô says the Tory MP whose workplace is a Victorian recreation of a medieval palace, where MPs are required to stay behind the two red lines in the carpet that are slightly more than two sword widths apart to stop MPs duelling during debates..

item.title: RT by @RaviSubbie: 3. Prevents courts from putting legal obligations on the state "to actively protect someone's human rights" (yep, that's a direct quote). Farewell to the only legal tools available to the Hillsborough families, survivors of Worboys attacks, patients at risk of suicide & many more
item.dc:creator: @marthaspurrier
item.description: 3. Prevents courts from putting legal obligations on the state "to actively protect someone's human rights" (yep, that's a direct quote). Farewell to the only legal tools available to the Hillsborough families, survivors of Worboys attacks, patients at risk of suicide & many more
